commitResults.messageBody:
In the current version of RepoSense, props are declared explicitly for
Vue components as an array of strings. 

Let's declare props using the object syntax so that we can document the
prop types.

This will also show a warning in the browser console if props of the
wrong type are passed to the component. 

Let's also define classes for `Segment` and `User` for stricter type 
validation.

Currently, the ramp chart only reflects number of insertions. Hence, 
commits that only delete code are omitted from the ramp chart.

Let us modify the ramp chart to include thin ramps to represent commits
that only delete code. Let us also include the number of lines deleted
when displaying lines changed on the Ramp Chart tooltip and on the
Commits Panel.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1865] Frontend: pin file title on scroll in the Code Panel (#1860)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, users cannot hide/collapse a file after they finish reading
through it, without scrolling back to the top again.

Let us pin the title of the file (which includes the collapse button) so
that the user can collapse a file when/after reading through it instead
of only on the top. Let us also position the tooltips to show/hide a
file dynamically based on whether they are out of the viewport.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1877] Show merge commits in the report (#1882)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, merge commits are completely ignored during report generation
and analysis. This misrepresents the number of commits the user has made
and misses out on important information included in the merge commits,
such as tags.

Let's include merge commits in the report so that important information
in such commits is not missed out.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1934] Fix wrong author name for merged groups in Commits Panel (#1935)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the Commits Panel shows the wrong author name for merged
groups, as it just picks the first author in the group. This is
misrepresentative of the work of all authors who have contributed to
the commits shown.

This bug has occurred due to a typo in the code, where one of the
instances of 'zIsMerge' was not renamed to `zIsMerged` as required.

Let us fix this typo so that the dashboard works as expected.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1220] Cypress: test ramp chart in zoom view (#1930)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there are very few tests for the ramp chart component of 
RepoSense. One aspect that is not tested is whether the ramps shown in 
the ramp chart are correct for the timeframe provided.

Let us make our front-end tests more robust by adding cypress tests to 
check whether the ramps shown in the ramp chart of the zoom view 
correspond with the commits from the selected time period. Let us also
test other aspects of the ramp chart like ramp properties, relative 
distances between ramps and links.

Node.js 14 will be reaching its end-of-life on 30 April 2023.

Let us update Node.js to use Node 16 in the GitHub workflows.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1537] Show authors for merged groups in Code Panel (#1939)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, when the "merge group" option is used for repos with multiple
authors, the Code Panel does not show which line of code was written by
which author.

Let us use different colors for the code segment backgrounds to indicate
who the author of the segment is. Let us also add an author legend for
each file to easily see who edited that particular file, and identify
which lines of code were written by whom.

Currently, despite the addition of TypeScript support, the frontend is
still largely written in JavaScript. This results in a lack of type
safety and many complex objects being passed around as unknown types,
which may in turn lead to errors.

Let's migrate one of the main components, c-zoom.vue, to TypeScript.
In addition to providing greater type safety, the migration of this
component will also allow the migration of its child components, such
as c-ramp.vue.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1004] Standardize fonts for consistency across panels (#1979)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are inconsistencies in the design between the different panels. 
One aspect that varies is the fonts used in terms of the font sizes and 
families. 

Let us standardize the font sizes across the Vue front-end using mixins.
Let us also set the font family for sans-serif to be Titillium Web and
monospace to be GitHub's default font.

The HTML report documentation is outdated after changes introduced in
recent PRs. This will make it difficult for new contributors to
understand the frontend codebase.

Let us update the documentation and puml diagrams to match the new files
and architecture. Let us also comment out the links used as examples to
avoid broken links.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2134] Fix broken code highlighting in Code Panel (#2135)
commitResults.messageBody:
The code highlighting is not working as the colors are not being
recognized by the newly extracted c-segment.vue file. This is because
the defined colors were not imported into the file.  

Let us add the color styles import to restore code highlighting
functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2164] Revert "[#2109] Add search by tag functionality" (#2165)
commitResults.messageBody:
Reverts PR #2116 to fix single group bug

Merging PR #2116 has caused all analysed charts to appear in a single group. 

Let us revert that merge commit as a hotfix to restore the original behaviour
while we investigate a solution.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert to Vue CLI to fix GitHub Pages Deployment (#2203)
commitResults.messageBody:
Revert to Vue CLI to fix GitHub Pages Deployment

Although Vite boasts better performance and is maintained actively,
its usage for GitHub Pages deployment requires specifying the base of the
deployment URL in the config. This makes it inconvenient as all existing
deployment dashboards must update the base respective to their URLs.  

Let's revert to Vue CLI temporarily to fix this.
